column1.content:
Adult Auditions

This site includes information that outlines what we look for in performers so people can assess their suitability for the show, and to help them prepare for auditions.

We would like to invite actors, dancers and singers from all backgrounds/ethnic groups to audition to be part of THE LION KING family. Although preferable, no previous training is required and you don't need to have an agent.

column2.content:
Childrens Auditions

Find out more about child auditions

topContent.content: What to prepare for the auditions

column1.content:
Singers

Performers need to prepare a contemporary rock, pop or gospel song and are asked to bring along sheet music for their song, written in the appropriate key; and presented in a manageable way for the pianist. Backing tapes are not permitted.

Performers should arrive early and make sure that they have warmed up vocally prior to their audition.

column2.content:
Dancers

Dancers do not need to prepare a dance routine for the audition. Dancers should arrive early for the audition in order to do their own physical warm up. Comfortable clothing that does not hide the dancer's physique should be worn. Flat jazz shoes or bare feet are suggested. Men are encouraged to bring trainers and women should bring pointe shoes, if they have them. Dancers should have a contemporary rock or pop song, with sheet music prepared in case they are short-listed.

textBlockFullWidth.content:
Learn more about the audition process

Singers & Actors

Auditions for singers and actors take place in three stages: Initial Auditions, Call-backs & Coaching and Final Auditions with the International Creative Team.

1. Initial Auditions

Auditions are advertised in newspapers, online, via agents and contact lists.

Auditionees are requested to come to the auditions with a contemporary rock, pop or gospel song prepared. A pianist is provided. Clear and well-laid out sheet music is required; and in the correct key for the singer. No backing tapes.

The auditionee will be given a set time to audition by the audition coordinator. At the audition the singer may be asked to sing only 16 bars (eg. verse and chorus) of the song they have prepared.

 

The Casting Director and Casting Coordinator are present at these auditions.

2. Call-backs and Coaching

Due to large-scale logistics we are unable to contact everyone who auditions. Should you be successful at the initial audition, you will be contacted by the Casting Department and sent material from the show to prepare for the next audition.

 

The material is usually a song and an acting piece for a particular character from THE LION KING. After the call-back audition the Casting Director will give feedback and may work on the acting piece with the auditionee. If the Music Director is present, there may also be some coaching on the song.

 

The Casting Director, Casting Coordinator, Music Director and the Resident Director may be present at these auditions.

There may be additional coaching sessions before the finals.

 

3. Final Auditions

Successful performers will be short-listed to audition for the International Creative Team.

 

The materials for this final audition will be the material prepared from the show and also a contemporary rock or pop song (not a cappella).

Dancers

Dance auditions usually take place in two major phases: initial auditions and then call-backs to the International Creative Team.

 

1. Initial Auditions

Auditions are advertised in newspapers, online, via agents and contact lists.

At the initial audition dancers may be seen on separate women's or men's days, or at mixed sessions. All dancers arrive at the beginning of auditions to register and are then auditioned during the day.

A short dance sequence adapted from THE LION KING is taught to the dancers by the Resident Dance Supervisor or Dance Captains. Dancers are assessed on their versatility and technique. At the end of each session unsuccessful dancers are notified and the successful dancers are asked to continue with the next session or asked to come back later in the day. By the end of the audition day the short-listed dancers remain. They may be asked to do another sequence from the show and sing for the Music Director.

2. Call-backs

Short-listed dancers are notified of their call-back to dance for the International Creative Team. These auditions follow much the same pattern as the initial auditions. At the end of this audition day male and female dancers are brought together for a final audition for evaluation by the international creative team.

auditionFields.content:
Adult Auditions: London Registration

Open auditions are held for adult roles in Disney’s THE LION KING once a year.

The next open auditions for singers will be held on Saturday 10 November 2018 at Bloomsbury Baptist Church, 235 Shaftesbury Ave, London, WC2H 8EP.
Registration is at 10am and closes promptly at 12pm.

The next open auditions for dancers will be held on Monday 26 November 2018 at Pineapple Studios, 7 Langley Street, London, WC2H 9JA.
Morning registration opens at 10am and closes promptly at 10.30am.
Afternoon registration opens at 1.30pm and closes promptly at 2pm.

To register your interest in auditioning for Disney’s The Lion King and to hear about when these auditions are next taking place, please fill in the registration form below

column1.content:
Children Auditions

In the stage version of THE LION KING there are two children’s roles: Young Simba and Young Nala. These characters are brace, athletic and energetic lion cubs

column2.content:
Adult Auditions

Find out more about adult auditions

column1.content:
London

We are always looking for children aged 8-11 to join our Cub School training programme, which will teach young performers skills in acting, movement and singing to later audition to potentially play these roles professionally in the West End.

Whilst winning a place in Cub School does not guarantee a part in the stage musical, it has proven to be excellent training for young people with the ambition to work on stage.

Applications for The Lion King Cub School are ongoing, and auditions are held twice a year. The next auditions will take place in March 2019.

Applicants for Cub School must be between ages 8 and 11 and below 140cm (4’6”) in height.

Please complete the form to register

Children registration form

column2.content:
UK & Ireland Tour

For all casting enquiries relating to the upcoming UK Touring production of The Lion King, please email Jo Hawes.

Email us

auditionFields.content:

We are always looking for children aged 8-11 to join our Cub School training programme, which will teach them skills in acting, movement and singing to later audition to potentially play these roles professionally in the West End.

Children are not required to prepare anything in advance of the Cub School auditions. One parent or guardian must accompany each child to the audition and stay on the premises until the audition has ended.

The next open auditions for Cub School will take place in March 2019

items.question: Access Concessions
items.answer:
There are concessionary rates for guests with certain access requirements. These can either be booked over the phone on 0800 912 6972, in person at the Box Office, or by emailing Lyceumboxoffice@theambassadors.com. Concessions are subject to availability.

Throughout the year there are a range of performances with enhanced accessibility, such as signed, captioned and audio described performances.

Click here for upcoming access performance dates and to read more about access facilities at the theatre.

items.question: Day Seats
items.answer:
A limited number of Day Seats priced at £20 per ticket are available to purchase from 10am on the day of each performance, in person at the Lyceum Theatre Box Office.

Each person is allowed to purchase a maximum of two tickets each. Subject to availability.

items.question: Bring a School Group
items.answer:
Over one million pupils have already experienced THE LION KING through its award-winning EDUCATION PROGRAMME. Combined with seeing the production, this programme will take your pupils on an engaging journey that they will never forget.

Developed by teachers, for teachers, the programme is fully curriculum linked to support subjects at KS2 and 3 and is easily adaptable.

All of the resources are available for free on a brand new online hub, the easy to use search tool allows you to discover activities and lesson plans that are relevant for your classroom.

Education Resources

Book now for selected performances until February 2020.

items.question: Relaxed Performances
items.answer: The Lion King will host a Relaxed Performance on Sunday 2nd June 2019. Click here for more information.

title: About the Show
metaDescription: Watch the trailer and latest videos from The Lion King on the official Disney website.

bgImageTextBlock.text:
Disney’s award-winning musical THE LION KING explodes with glorious colours, stunning effects and enchanting music. It follows the powerful story of Simba as he journeys from wide-eyed cub to his destined role as King of the Pridelands.

Now in its 20th year at London's Lyceum Theatre, visionary director Julie Taymor’s acclaimed reimagining of Disney's beloved film will redefine your expectation of theatre.

title: Cast & Creatives
metaDescription: Find out more about the cast and creatives of The Lion King, London’s Landmark Musical, and buy tickets from the official Disney website.

title: Your Visit
metaDescription: Get answers to frequently asked questions about your visit to THE LION KING on the official Disney website.

textBlockFullWidth.content:
How do I get there?

Lyceum Theatre
21 Wellington Street
London WC2E 7RQ

Click to check your route

items.title: Underground & Train
items.content:
The nearest stations are:

  • Charing Cross – Network South East
  • Waterloo and Waterloo East – Bakerloo, Northern and Jubilee Lines
  • Covent Garden – Piccadilly Line
  • Temple – Circle & District Lines
  • Leicester Square – Piccadilly and Northern Lines
  • Charing Cross – Bakerloo, Norther and Jubilee Lines
  • Holborn – Piccadilly and Central Lines
  • Embankment – Bakerloo, Northern, and District & Circle Lines

items.title: Bus
items.content: To reach the theatre by bus, use numbers 1, 6, 9, 11, 13, 15, 23, 68, 77A, 91, 176 or 341 with Leicester Square as the destination. The closest bus interchange for all London routes and night buses is Trafalgar Square.

items.title: Parking
items.content:
You can save 50% with Q-Park’s Theatreland Parking Scheme. Click here for full details.

The nearest NCP car parks are on Parker Street, Museum Street, Holborn and the St. Martin’s Lane Hotel.

items.title: Cycle
items.content: There is a self-hire bike docking station directly outside the theatre, provided by Transport for London. Click here for details

items.question: How long is the show?
items.answer: The performance lasts approximately 2 hours and 30 minutes including an interval.

items.question: Is there a minimum age requirement to attend the show?
items.answer:
THE LION KING is recommended for a general audience. We recommend THE LION KING for ages 6 and up. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted into the theatre.

All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own within the auditorium.

All persons entering the theatre, regardless of age, must have a ticket.

items.question: What should I wear?
items.answer: There is no dress code at the theatre. For all performances, attire should be comfortable and appropriate for the occasion.

items.question: Does the show use any special effects?
items.answer: THE LION KING contains theatrical smoke and fog effects as well as strobe lighting during parts of the show.

items.question: How can I audition to be in the show?
items.answer: For information about auditioning click here.

items.question: Is THE LION KING playing in a city near me?
items.answer:
THE LION KING continues to be performed at the Lyceum Theatre in London. In addition, a UK and Ireland tour begins in September 2019. To find out more, click ‘Select City’ at the top of this page and choose the location nearest to you for more details. Further cities will be announced in the coming months. The show will continue to play in London while the tour takes place.

In addition to the UK and Ireland, THE LION KING is also performed in cities around the world.
Click here for worldwide productions.

items.question: Does THE LION KING offer day seats?
items.answer: A limited number of Day Seats priced at £20 per ticket are available to purchase each morning in person at the Lyceum Theatre Box Office. Each person is allowed to purchase a maximum of two tickets each. Subject to availability.

items.question: I have a question about my booking, who can I contact?
items.answer:
If you booked through Tickets, please click here for more information.

If you booked via ATG Tickets or the Lyceum Theatre Box Office, please click here.

If you booked elsewhere, please contact your point of purchase.

items.question: Is official THE LION KING merchandise available to purchase at the theatre?
items.answer: Merchandise is available to purchase before and after the show, and during the interval across a number of locations inside the theatre. You can pay for merchandise with either cash or credit/debit card – all card types are accepted. For pre-orders or for any other enquiries contact merchandise@disneytheatrical.co.uk.

items.question: How do I contact someone at THE LION KING?
items.answer:
If you would like to write to a member of the cast please send a letter to:
[Cast member Name]
The Lyceum Theatre
21 Wellington Street
London, WC2E 7RQ
Please note that we cannot guarantee that all letters will receive a response.

To reach the Disney Theatrical Group press office, submit your request here.

To discover employment opportunities with Disney Theatrical Group, visit Disney Careers.

items.question: Are there cloakroom facilities available?
items.answer: Cloakroom facilities are available for coats and umbrellas, however we are unable to accept large bags and luggage. We strongly advise that you do not bring large bags to the theatre.

title: Access
metaDescription: Find out about access performances, wheelchair and hearing facilities at THE LION KING, London’s Landmark Musical, on the official Disney website.

items.question: How do I find out about access facilities at the theatre?
items.answer:
The Lyceum Theatre is fully accessible to disabled, deaf and visually impaired guests. THE LION KING is committed to making your experience as easy and enjoyable as possible.


If you have any specific requirements / questions please call 0800 912 6972 or email lyceumbo@theambassadors.com.

items.question: Are there facilities for people with visual impairments?
items.answer:
THE LION KING regularly schedules audio described performances for those with visual impairments in association with VocalEyes. Audio description in theatre is a live verbal commentary on the visual elements of a production, delivered as a performance unfolds, through a discreet headset.

The next audio described performances of THE LION KING will take place on Sunday 1 September 2019 at 2.30pm.

Guide Dogs are welcome in the auditorium or can alternatively be left in the care of theatre staff. If you intend to bring a guide dog, please let your sales advisor know at the time of booking.

The Lyceum Theatre has a limited number of large print and Braille programmes available. Please contact the Front of House Manager in advance on 020 7420 8100 (calls charged at local rate) to request a copy.

A copy of THE LION KING script is available in braille and an appointment can be made to read it in the theatre by calling 020 7420 8100 (calls charged at local rate) in advance.

items.question: Are there facilities for people with hearing impairments?
items.answer:
THE LION KING regularly schedules sign-interpreted performances in association with Theatre Sign. Throughout the performance, a qualified theatre sign interpreter stands on the left of the stage and uses sign language to relay music and words to deaf and hearing impaired patrons, all of whom are seated within easy viewing distance of both the stage and interpreter.

The next signed performances will take place on Tuesday 30 April 2019 at 7.30pm and Sunday 4 August 2019 at 2.30pm.

We regularly schedule captioned performances of THE LION KING in association with Stagetext. Captioning is a way of converting the spoken word into visible text that provides deaf, deafened and hard of hearing people with access to live performance.

The next captioned performances of THE LION KING will take place on Sunday 21 July 2019 at 2.30pm.

items.question: When is the next assisted performance?
items.answer:
The next captioned performances, presented in association with Stagetext, will take place on Sunday 21 July 2019 at 2.30pm.

The next signed (BSL) performances, presented in association with Theatre Sign, will take place on Tuesday 30 April 2019 at 7.30pm and Sunday 4 August 2019 at 2.30pm.

The next audio described performances of THE LION KING, presented in association with VocalEyes, will take place on Sunday 1 September 2019 at 2.30pm

It is advisable to book for these performances well in advance as tickets are subject to availability.

items.question: How do I book access concessions?
items.answer: Disabled, deaf and visually impaired concessions can either be booked over the phone on 0800 912 6972, in person at the Box Office, or by emailing lyceumbo@theambassadors.com. Concessions are subject to availability.

items.question: Is the theatre accessible for wheelchair users?
items.answer:
There are eight wheelchair spaces available in the Stalls seating area.


The wheelchair accessible entrance is via a double exit door situated at the front of the theatre on Wellington Street. This is clearly marked and provides level access to the Accessible Toilets, the Stalls Bar and the Stalls seating area.


The theatre’s main entrance is up three steps to the lower foyer. From here there are 7 steps down to the Stalls and 12 steps up to the Royal Circle landing. The Grand Circle is up 83 steps.


There are lift facilities available to all levels of the Lyceum Theatre, located via the entrance on Exeter Street. All levels, apart from the Stalls, are laid out over a number of steps.

items.question: Are there disabled parking spaces close to the theatre?
items.answer:
There are parking spaces for blue badge holders close to the theatre.

The nearest car parks are located in Chinatown and Leicester Square and can be booked in advance by calling Qpark on 0800 243 348

Tickets for the Theatreland parking scheme can be validated within the Lyceum Theatre. This can be done in the foyer cloakroom.

items.question: Does THE LION KING schedule relaxed performances?
items.answer: The Lion King will host a Relaxed Performance in June 2019. Click here for more information.

items.question: Are there any resources available to help prepare for my visit?
items.answer:
Watch the video visual story below to learn what you will experience when you arrive at the Lyceum Theatre.



You can also download a PDF copy of the Lyceum Theatre visual story here.

column1.content:
Autism-Friendly Relaxed Performances

Book now to attend the next Autism-Friendly Relaxed Performance on Sunday 2nd June 2019.

THE LION KING is committed to creating a friendly and inclusive audience experience at the Lyceum Theatre, London and is delighted to present its sixth Autism-Friendly Relaxed Performance at 1.30pm on Sunday 2nd June.

Autism-Friendly Relaxed Performances are specially adapted to be accessible to a wide range of audiences such as those with Autism, those with a learning disability, or anyone with sensory disposition. There are extra trained staff on hand, and dedicated quiet areas inside the theatre should anyone need to leave their seat.

Any patrons who feel this performance might suit their specific needs, or the needs of their family members or companions, are warmly encouraged to attend.

Book now

column2.content: What is an autism-friendly performance?

column1.content:
Visual Story

Our 'Visual Story' will guide you step-by-step through your visit to the Lyceum Theatre to see The Lion King.

Download PDF

Watch Film

column2.content:
“Hakuna Matata on a Sunday Afternoon”

Read a moving account of the 2013 performance at The Lyceum by Lizi Jackson from her blog Through Accepting Limits.

Read blog

Autism Friendly Award

In 2018 The National Autistic Society awarded Disney’s THE LION KING and the Lyceum Theatre an Autism-Friendly Award.

The award demonstrates our commitment to making the theatre experience welcoming to autistic pple and their families at every stage, with clear information available before and during your visit, trained members of staff across the theatre teams, and a commitment to raising awareness of autism among the general public.

column1.content:
EDUCATION

Education Group Rates up to Year 13

Education group sales currently available on selected seats and performances until February 2020, excluding school holiday periods and additional black-out dates as determined by Disney in its sole discretion. Valid for Tuesday to Thursday evenings and Wednesday matinee performances only. Rate applies for groups of 10+ (primary or secondary school pupils up to and including Year 13). Groups pay £29.50 per ticket in the Stalls & Royal Circle and £22.50 in Grand Circle for the same performance. For off-peak performances in February 2020, groups pay £25 per ticket in the Stalls & Royal Circle and £19.50 in Grand Circle for the same performance. For every ten (10) paid tickets, Group receives one (1) free ticket for use by a teacher. Education group tickets purchased shall not be offered for re-sale via social media channels to individual members, unless otherwise agreed in writing by The Walt Disney Company and all attendees must be from the same University or education group (we reserve the right to verify these details at the theatre). Offer is subject to availability and may be revoked at any time. All sales final. No refunds or exchanges permitted. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Once issued, tickets cannot be replaced if lost, stolen or destroyed and is only valid for the event for which it is issued. The unlawful resale or attempted resale of the ticket is grounds for seizure and cancellation without compensation. Holder agrees, by the use of the ticket, not to transmit or aid in transmitting any description, account, picture, or reproduction of the show. Holder grants permission to Disney to use the holder’s image or likeness in connection with any live or recorded video or other transmission of the show. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted to the theatre. All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own in the auditorium.

Education Group Rates for University and Full Time Education Groups

University and Full Time Education group sales currently available on selected seats and performances until February 2020, excluding school holiday periods and additional black-out dates as determined by Disney in its sole discretion. Valid for Tuesday to Thursday evenings and Wednesday matinee performances only. Groups of 10+ (post Year 13) pay £33.50 per ticket in the Stalls & Royal Circle and £29.50 in Grand Circle for the same performance. For every ten (10) paid tickets, Group receives one (1) free ticket free for use by a teacher. Education group tickets purchased shall not be offered for re-sale via social media channels to individual members, unless agreed in writing by The Walt Disney Company. Offer is subject to availability and may be revoked at any time. All sales final. No refunds or exchanges permitted. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Once issued, tickets cannot be replaced if lost, stolen or destroyed and is only valid for the event for which it is issued. The unlawful resale or attempted resale of the ticket is grounds for seizure and cancellation without compensation. Holder agrees, by the use of the ticket, not to transmit or aid in transmitting any description, account, picture, or reproduction of the show. Holder grants permission to Disney to use the holder’s image or likeness in connection with any live or recorded video or other transmission of the show. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted to the theatre. All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own in the auditorium

To make an enquiry online, visit the Bristol Hippodrome Groups Booking page, by clicking here.

title: About the Show
metaDescription: Watch the trailer and latest videos from The Lion King on the official Disney website.

bgImageTextBlock.text:
Disney’s award-winning musical THE LION KING explodes with glorious colours, stunning effects and enchanting music. It follows the powerful story of Simba as he journeys from wide-eyed cub to his destined role as King of the Pridelands.

Now in its 20th year at London's Lyceum Theatre, visionary director Julie Taymor’s acclaimed reimagining of Disney's beloved film will redefine your expectation of theatre.

title: Cast & Creatives
metaDescription: Find out more about the cast and creatives of The Lion King, London’s Landmark Musical, and buy tickets from the official Disney website.

title: Relaxed Performance
metaDescription: See it now in Bristol. Book tickets here. Coming to Bristol and Edinburgh in 2019. Sign up now.

column1.content:
Relaxed Performances

Tickets are now on sale for the Relaxed Performance at The Bristol Hippodrome.

THE LION KING is committed to creating a friendly and inclusive audience experience. Having hosted a hugely successful Autism-Friendly Performance in its inaugural tour in 2013, along with five Autism-Friendly Performances in the Lyceum Theatre London, the landmark musical is delighted to be presenting a Relaxed Performance in The Bristol Hippodrome on Tuesday 19 November at 5pm.

Relaxed performances are designed to provide an opportunity for people with autism, learning difficulties or other sensory and communication needs who might prefer a more relaxed environment.

Any patrons who feel this performance might suit their specific needs, or the needs of their family members or companions, are warmly encouraged to attend.

Book Tickets

column2.content: What is an autism-friendly performance?

column1.content:
EDUCATION

Education Group Rates up to Year 13

*Education group sales available on selected seats at selected performances, excluding school holiday periods and additional black-out dates as determined by Disney in its sole discretion. Valid for Wednesday matinee and Wednesday evening performances only. Stalls & Grand Circle reduced to £27.50, Upper Circle reduced to £20.50. For every ten (10) tickets purchased the group receives one (1) additional ticket free for use by a teacher. Education group tickets purchased shall not be offered for re-sale via social media channels to individual members, unless otherwise agreed in writing by The Walt Disney Company. Offer is subject to availability, may be revoked at any time and not available on premium seating. All sales final. No refunds or exchanges permitted. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Additional restrictions apply, please enquire for more details. © Disney

column2.content:
GROUPS

Group Sales Terms and Conditions

Group rates currently available from 10 September 2019 through to 21 November 2019. Valid only for Tue to Thur evenings and Wed matinee performances. Tickets for groups 10-39 from £30 and groups 40+ from £28. Group rates are unavailable during school holiday periods, additional blackout dates and restrictions apply. Group rates can only be applied to tickets being booked at the same time. Not all seats for eligible performances are discounted. No refunds or exchanges. Prices may vary on selected performances. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Group discount may be revoked at any time without notice. © Disney

column1.content:
Relaxed Performances

Tickets are now on sale for the Relaxed Performance at the Edinburgh Playhouse.

THE LION KING is committed to creating a friendly and inclusive audience experience. Having hosted a hugely successful Autism-Friendly Performance in its inaugural tour in 2013, along with five Autism-Friendly Performances in the Lyceum Theatre London, the landmark musical is delighted to be presenting a Relaxed Performance in the Edinburgh Playhouse on Sunday 26 January 2020 at 1.30pm.

Relaxed performances are designed to provide an opportunity for people with autism, learning difficulties or other sensory and communication needs who might prefer a more relaxed environment.

Book Tickets

column2.content: What is an autism-friendly performance?

column1.content:
EDUCATION

Education Group Rates up to Year 13

*Education group sales available on selected seats at selected performances, excluding school holiday periods and additional black-out dates as determined by Disney in its sole discretion. Valid for Tuesday to Thursday evening and Wednesday matinee performances only. On Wednesday and Thursday evening performances, Stalls & Circle reduced to £25, Balcony reduced to £19.50. On Tuesday evening and Wednesday matinee performances, Stalls & Circle reduced to £25, Balcony reduced to £16.50. For every ten (10) tickets purchased the group receives one (1) additional ticket free for use by a teacher. Education group tickets purchased shall not be offered for re-sale via social media channels to individual members, unless otherwise agreed in writing by The Walt Disney Company. Offer is subject to availability, may be revoked at any time and not available on premium seating. All sales final. No refunds or exchanges permitted. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Additional restrictions apply, please enquire for more details. © Disney

column2.content:
GROUPS

Group Sales Terms and Conditions

*Group rates currently available on selected seats at selected performances, excluding school holiday periods and additional black-out dates as determined by Disney in its sole discretion. Valid for Tuesday to Friday evening and Wednesday matinee performances only. On Wednesday, Thursday and Friday evening performances, tickets for groups 10-24 from £35, groups 25-49 from £32.50 and groups 50+ from £25. On Tuesday evening and Wednesday matinee performances, tickets for groups 10-24 from £25, groups 25-49 from £22.50 and groups 50+ from £20. Group rates can only be applied to tickets being booked at the same time. Not all seats for eligible performances are discounted. No refunds or exchanges. Prices may vary on selected performances. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Group discount may be revoked at any time without notice. © Disney
